website_summaries.verdict: A large capacity oil sprayer with a trigger handle that is easy to use and does not have to be pumped for pressure.
pros: Stainless steel bottle keeps your oil from being affected by the sunlight
Can be used with several different types of oils, vinegar, juice, or wine
Dip tube extends nicely to the edge of the bottle
cons: You need to learn how to use the trigger to get the misting function to work properly
It is not 100% intuitive, but works well if you do it right

customer_reviews.title: Use pliers to adjust the hose
customer_reviews.text: I just want you to know that you can use pliers to adjust the little hose. Mine came with hose pointing backwards. So if you want to lean the bottle forward to use last of the oil, simply use pliers to twist it into place. I figured this out after 6 months. Hope this helps someone. I could not twist it with my fingers. Needed pliers. I was afraid of breaking it, but it fortunately did not break.
customer_reviews.author: Just the facts

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from it
customer_reviews.text: The cap broke after 6 months of light use. The glass bottle is too heavy for the plastic trigger. Do not buy it unless you want olive oil spilled all around your kitchen. See pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: Beware of lid that works its way loose from the glass sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Concept is great but apparently as you continue to use the sprayer the lid works itself loose. I made French fries and chicken tenders in air fryer and had successfully sprayed with it about 10 times. Reached to get the bottle to spray one last spritz and the lid was no longer attached to the bottle. The bottle crashed to the floor and broke in about 100 shards that flew from my kitchen all the way down the hallway. Almost an entire bottle of oil all over the place along with the glass. It took a little over an hour to clean the mess up.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: The canola oil spray cans sprays a nice even mist of cooking oil to a frying pan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that I would not have to buy canola oil spray cans. The canola oil spray cans sprays a nice even mist of cooking oil to a frying pan. This Evo spays in big uneven globs to a frying pan. Just to hopefully show you the difference, I attached two photos. The first photo is a frying pan sprayed with a canola oil spray can. The second photo it the same flying pan sprayed with canola oil using the Evo.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Lacsamana

customer_reviews.title: The sprayer is very nice, however
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer is very nice, however, the threads are stripped on the bottle so the spray nozzle won't stay on. I emailed the company to try to get them to make it right but got no response. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it - Spray pattern photos attached.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to wok fine for my purpose - Canola oil on popcorn. Attached are photos of the three spray patterns of Canola oil with the nozzle six inches from the paper.
customer_reviews.author: pat Photo, video, computer geek

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Photo, Can't Return
customer_reviews.text: This is cheaply made misrepresented in the photo. long, black band around neck is sloppily seamed in three places with corresponding wrinkles next to each of the awful seams,each the full length of the black part. And take note.....somewhere hidden in the description must be the words "Not Returnable," which is what I just discovered as I tried to return the piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: GDJ

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I filled with soapy water and tested biggest waste of money ever. i thought maybe water is too thin. I tried olive oil extra virgin, one stream down the center. i wasted that and tried corn oil the cheapest crap at the store and t sprayed one stream down the center. I grabbed the 2nd bottle and it was just as bad. i have $.50 dime store specials that do better Update, filled with butter. Worked ok when warm. Hot tap water melts bottles.
customer_reviews.author: I am a GeekTop Contributor: BBQ Styles

customer_reviews.title: Over-sprays too much oil
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This is a terrible product. Each spray puts out about 1 teaspoon of oil. If I wanted that much oil I would pour it straight from the bottle. I hoped that it would do as advertised and just give a mist amount. No. Too much. I just used it on a try of vegetables and had to rinse the vegetables in hot water to get the thick coating off and then wash the tray. Big mess all over the counter too, and it was a direct spray that obviously had too much power. No way to regulate the sprayer either, just an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: EllenA

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but
customer_reviews.text: This is a good concept that it doesn't use propellants as most of the canned oil sprays do. I like the design and it's easy to spray. That said, instead of a mist, the spray is uneven and sprays more oil than I would normally use. Plus it sprays in a horizontal squirt and even when I quickly move the bottle in a downward motion to try and even out the oil spray, there's a larger concentration of oil on the sides. While I am disappointed that it doesn't give an even mist like the propellant cans do, I will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tropigal

customer_reviews.title: Sprays inconsistently
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer doesn't shoot a mist or a solid stream as advertised. Instead it shoots out a random stream out both sides of the opening at about a 45-degree angle. Sometimes out one side, sometimes out the other, sometimes both-hard to predict. So you can spray both outside edges of your dish, or the center of the dish and the counter - your choice. Or you can hold the bottle super close to your food and squeeze very gently so that the oil lightly drops onto your food, which defeats the whole purpose of having this damn sprayer anyway. I'm going back to the Misto thing.
customer_reviews.author: John Anderson

customer_reviews.title: If you receive a defective one, there is no exchange or return for this item!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oil bottle after viewing their video where the spray bottle nozzle gives out different size and styles of spray patterns. When I received it, no matter which way I turn the nozzle, it sprays or rather squirts out oil and that too a lot of oil. I immediately realized this could be a defective product and thought of exchanging it with a better one. But guess what!! This item isn’t eligible for return. You end up with a beautiful little bottle, that is defective. I have to throw it out now and add more trash to the environment!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deepthi

customer_reviews.title: I needed a spray bottle that was food Safe for ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a spray bottle that was food Safe for basting my food on my pellet smoker. I mainly use it for misting ribs. I use a mixture of oil, juice and vinegar. There is two options of spray. It can't handle any spices. There are reviews that say it clogs, not true as long as you don't use any solids or spices in your liquid. After I was finished, I used warm water and cleared the spray of my remaining mixture. The container is made of metal so, no worries of it melting at the grill. Contents are not under pressure, all you do is spray. Finally, have a food safe container.
customer_reviews.author: The Gigler

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Oil Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Nice sprayer. Works really well. Little pricey, but worth it. Great addition to the kitchen and wonderful on the grill and the air fryer. UPDATE: After 4 months it no longer works. It sends oil in a 10 ft stream across the room or nothing at all. Soapy water it sprays great. But it doesn't unclog the sprayer. I contacted Delta Industries by email on website. I have now submitted a replacement spray nozzle request form.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a grill with cast iron grates. I needed to be able to easily coat them with oil to make sure they stay seasoned. This doesn't spray a mist but it does shoot a wide fan of oil out to quickly and easily cover the grates. Having used misters, aerosol oil canisters, etc., this is the best way to keep the grill seasoned. If you're looking for a delicate mister to lightly apply oil, you don't want this. If you want a little more oil than a light mist, then this fits the bill. It is absolutely fantastic for grilling, even if you just want to spray on a little oil to make it more non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Malin

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made but fails in its primary function - consistent spraying of oil.
customer_reviews.text: This oil sprayer is very disappointing It fails to deliver a consistent "spray" with even coverage - it is more like an oil spitter than sprayer. The description for the product twice uses the words "unique fan pattern" which may be correct if you consider an inconsistent application of oil desirable. Note that it has both a stream and spray setting, neither of which is consistent in the delivery of the oil. This "spitter" has everything going for it - construction, materials, design, but fails in its primary function.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Lange

customer_reviews.title: Better than the expensive oil spray bottle
customer_reviews.text: I had a EVO oil spray bottle for many years. Like most things they eventually break. I was going to order another EVO oil sprayer, but once I read not such great reviews, I decided to upgrade and get a better brand. After about 2 months I was just disliking the upgraded brand. It didn't spray evenly along with barely any oil coming out. So, I decide to get rid of that oil sprayer and go back to what made me happy for many years. I am enjoying this EVO oil sprayer very much!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Daley

customer_reviews.title: Sprays wide and thick, but it does not clog
customer_reviews.text: An air fryer is almost useless without an oil sprayer. This is the best I've found, but it's not perfect. The spray is somewhat heavy. And it sprays wide, in a fan shape. If I'm trying to target a small spot, forget it. I spray more oil than I need, but the nozzle does not clog. Any spray is better than no spray, and it's also better than a fine mist. A fine mist is good for some things, but it's not effective for coating dry batter on fish fillets, meat cutlets, chicken parts or onion rings.
customer_reviews.author: I Do The Speed LimitTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Defective and unable to return
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the smaller version which is excellent. This particular unit DOES NOT PUMP and it is listed as 'unable to return'. Truthfully -- all I want is a replacement that works but not an option. I would not recommend purchasing if they won't stand behind their product. Very disappointing since it is an excellent product when in full working order.
customer_reviews.author: MamaJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I have had over a year
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to spray oil on the grill before cooking. This works great! I had tried other misters, spray bottles, etc. I think this is the best. Clean with high proof grain alcohol you get at a liquor store (everclear, etc. 180 proof). Put a little in the bottle, let sit, swirl around and spray some out. let dry, it is clean!
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Form follows fuction, Great ergometric design worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Orginally i purchased a much different sprayer which did not spray just squirted. The Evo sprayer sprays or squirts with the least of effort. At 75 my fingers are arthritic and have very little strength, The Evo is easy to hold, easy to spray, and easy to fill with a screw on funnel provided. Its simple and elegant design has incorporated excellent funcionality for strong as well as weak hands. It hold a lot of oil but it is not so large as to be akward to use or to sit on the stove when cool. It is plastice and will not do well on a heated stove top. The Evo is well worth its purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Wanderers

customer_reviews.title: Not as fine a mist as I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for something that would spray a somewhat fine mist of olive oil, but this definitely wasn't the answer. It sprays a fan-shaped pattern that spans from one side to the other, instead of a cone-shaped spray. The droplets are fairly large, and the each pull of the trigger sprays quite a lot of oil, making it difficult to do any kind of light spray. If you squeeze the trigger softly, it makes a small stream instead. I feel like I wasted a lot of money on this particular kitchen mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Another ShopperTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: sprayer did not work
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a Christmas gift. First time using it today. filled it with oil, sprayed and sprayed (and sprayed and sprayed) nothing ever came out. Very disappointed. And apparently it is not something I can return, even though it IS defective. That was a nice "to bad so sad but we already have your money so it sucks to be you" I cant believe they wont let me return it. That's total BS! amazon you really dropped the ball on this one. In my opinion that's thievery pure and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Turner

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of this sprayer. The Evo Oil Sprayer did not work at all an Amazon will not allow a return. Twenty dollars wasted. The oil would not rise through the tube no matter how much I tried. Quite messy too. I bought the smaller Evo sprayer the past I've twice but the trigger snapped in short order so I bought another brand and was happy. When it fell and broke I thought I'd give Evo another chance - perhaps they have improved their product. Not so! Stay away - it's not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Works really well! No more Pam aerosol spray cans!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently aerosol spray bottles are SUPER bad for the environment. I had no idea. But these spray bottles work really well! You can fill with whatever oil you have at home. It's not a super fine mist spray like the aerosal cans but who cares. You're just trying to make stuff not stick to your pan! This works perfect for that. Haven't tried putting olive oil since we never spray that, we just drizzle it on things. But we have 1 bottle for canola and 1 for vegetable oil. I've had it for 2 months now and we are always using it! It's great! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: AoiMizuno

customer_reviews.title: Best Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sprayer! It has always been highly recommended and I was fortunate enough to finally be able to get this in the stainless. Having read some reviews about it wouldn't spray correctly, I watched the YouTube video that said to make sure the tube was curved in the same direction as the sprayer head. I did that and have had no problems. I use this one for avocado oil and plan on getting another one for canola oil. The only thing is that I wish I could get the tabs that have the different oil names separately that come with the other EVO sprayers. They don't come with the stainless one and I wish they did.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Dove

customer_reviews.title: Sprays oil everywhere
customer_reviews.text: There's much I like about this sprayer; it gives good and even coverage and each spray is the same-good if you have a larger spraying job (unlike air pressure sprayers which get weaker the longer they spray). And it does not clog. However, the dispersion is too big-it sprays oil everywhere. If you get closer to prevent that, you end up with too much oil on the target. It also drips oil all over the trigger and bottle. Most likely, I will go back to an air pressure sprayer-they are not perfect either, but at least they don't leave a big mess to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Cute little oil spray bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a better spray but I can guess I can make do. Handle is easy to squeeze and my 91 year old mother has no problem using. Our only gripe is that it doesn't give a full aersol spray. It seems to spray at a wide angle instead of full spray like store bought non stick spray. Also if you spray to close to the item than it is more like a stream than a spray. You have to hold it pretty far back to get the spray. It is the right size for for our uses. I hope in time we can get used to it and it doesn't end up in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Topasna

customer_reviews.title: Trash product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had nothing but problems with this thing since I got it. I assumed I clogged the thing with some sort of spice in a marinade. I cleaned the thing a billion times, and only sometimes get it to work. Now I see this is a common problem with this thing which is *not* cheap. Half the time I just open the bottle up and pour marinade directly on the food because the sprayer sucks. I consistently have trouble opening the top as well. It gets stuck and there’s no place to grip it. A complete trash product at a premium price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fine Wide Mist of Oil
customer_reviews.text: Most sprayers do not do as well with oil as you want them to. This one gives a nice wide fine spray that's great for air fryers or any other time you want to coat but not drown something in oil. The action is consistent, and the sprayer seems durable. The Michael Graves design also makes it easy to leave this out on a counter, which is good, because storage space is becoming harder to find as it becomes clearer that we can probably expect more supply chain issues. Love.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: If you want to spray your entire cook top with oil, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.text: These have one setting, a wide and heavy flat stream from left to right. Spraying a 10" cast iron skillet is way too much work as the pattern just makes a stripe in te muddle. Build quality is good, bottles are ergo friendly to use. The main thing you would use them for, spraying a light mist over a pan, they fail at.
customer_reviews.author: G.H.

customer_reviews.title: Won't Spray and no customer service number
customer_reviews.text: I just received my sprayer and it doesn't spray! I put soapy water in it to clean it prior to putting oil in it. It did not spray at all, not a drop came out. I tried all 4 possible positions for the nozel setting and, nothing! To make matters worse there is no customer service number to call. It comes in a plactic bag and they could easily print a number on the bag. I suppose I can look it up on the internet but how about making it easy? Very disappoointed, guess I'll send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sharf

customer_reviews.title: Garden Hose sprayer
customer_reviews.text: It sprays oil like water garden hose! Way too hard - splashes everywhere. And then drips the remains of oil straight down to the handle. Ridiculously unusable for cooking. Unfortunately missed the return window. Waste of money. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: MMM613

customer_reviews.title: Provides a stream of oil vice a mist of oil.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to get an oil mist to put a light coating of oil on cookware and (as this product promised) on food; sadly it fails. The EVO does provide the promised 1/4 tsp of oil per spray but it comes out in a stream vice a mist. Putting a blob of oil in the pan or on the food vice the promised mist. I have tried the soaking in vinegar suggestion but that didn't work for me. Of course there should be no need for any repair solution right out of the box. Sadly I gave a few of these as gifts and am now totally embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: Montycs

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work and Can't Return It - What a Rip Off
customer_reviews.text: Paid $22.99.. for two pack after reading reviews. Followed instructions and loaded with oil. Oil came up straw but does not spray. Tried various adjustments, still does not work. Item not eligible for return. This is what is called unjust enrichment. You get my money, I get an unusable lemon product. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good as long as you get a good one
customer_reviews.text: Sprays well with an entire line (either vertical or horizontal). First one I bought was great. In fact, I bought a second one because I liked it so much. Second one I received did not spray properly, but I would not have known this if I didn't already have another one that was working as intended. It was spraying much less than normal and not in any particular pattern. I requested a replacement and that one works well. So it seems like the main issues are price and potential quality control. I've tried several different kinds of sprayers before and this is still the best as long as it works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: Defective piece sent
customer_reviews.text: The spray of this bottle does not work the way it is described. The local bottles available in stores have far better spray nozzles and are 15x cheaper than this. The single stream also is not continuous when I spray, leave aside the even spray option. It doesn’t spray with multiple streams at all. I have received a defective piece with no option to return/refund. My friend ordered the small set of evo bottles and her spray nozzles are awesome. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Functional but missing box and funnel
customer_reviews.text: The spray worked as advertised but it is did not come with the funnel to pour the oil, the label band to put the sprayer, or packaging. It was basically thrown in a cardboard box without even a plastic wrapping.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: Too much spray
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I think should provide a finer spray. If the pump it's not pulled back hard enough or fast enough too much oil comes out. In addition, the spray area is very large and you have to aim accurately so as not to get oil outside the pan. I end up holding the pan over the sink so that the oil does not get all over the counter top.. While it is much better then frying in a pan, I feel it still provides too much oil.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Defective and very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer is defective and very poor quality. Spray discharges way to much oil, is to thick and is very uneven. Spray leaves many drips all over. I called Amazon to return but they are closed due to Covid-19 so I will have to throw sprayer out and loose my money. Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this product has been poor. It has not worked properly since received brand new. It sprays once and then I must constantly shake the bottle to get it to spray again. This is frustrating when opening the hood/door of a smoker/oven trying to quickly spray your meat without letting all of your heat escape. A simple spray bottle shouldn’t be this much trouble. Whether you get a good working bottle is a crap shoot. I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tadaia

customer_reviews.title: Great oil sprayer
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these for 2 years in our restaurant and have little to no problems. I occasionally have to run hot water through the nozzle and straw if they get gummed up, but that only happens after a couple months. We use this constantly, everyday in our pizzeria so we have put them through their paces. This has been the best oil sprayer I have come across.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy - Would have been good to adjust the sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: 1) I have searched for a durable bottle for olive oil and used few that failed me. 2) This one has stainless steel body which is very useful - it doesn't break. Olive oil sprayer is something that moves around a lot - it's very useful to have unbreakable body. 3) The press mechanism also works great so far. 4) I gave it 4 stars and not 5 since the sprayer doesn't spray in a very convenient way. It's very wide and hard to to make small amount or to focus it on specific area. It would have been very useful if you could adjust the sprayer (as you have in many other products that spray).
customer_reviews.author: Hanan Rubin חנן רובין

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and only the bottle was there. There is no sprayer. I tried to return the product and was told this product cannot be returned.
customer_reviews.author: chinook

customer_reviews.title: Using ours with avocado oil
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 16oz sprayer to fill with avocado oil for our grill. So far, we've had the sprayer for going on two months, and I haven't experienced any problems. It sprays a nice, even amount and hasn't clogged. I will keep the review updated if any arise. I recommend this product. If you found this review helpful, please click the 'helpful' button below.
customer_reviews.author: oneboyonegirl

customer_reviews.title: It is a very good product for spraying your own olive oil on a ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good product for spraying your own olive oil on a pan or on vegetables for roasting or putting a final touch on baking in the oven. I have bought several (the Plastic one) for presents as well which contain more oil than this but I melted my last one by leaving next to a very high BTU gas burner.This one contains less liquid but it does not melt like the plastic
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: Healthy eatting with spray Non-Aerosol OIL
customer_reviews.text: First bend the straw so it faces the spray nozzle otherwise when the oil is getting low, it wont come out. I use this with my air fryer as well with anything I fry in a pan. It reduces that amount of oil that you use and consume. I use one for my olive oil and one for my vegetable oil. I have more so I can flavor my oils. I don't use butter anymore, just oils.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: BIG DISAPPOINT, DOESN'T WORK!
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer worked about two times, then after that it consistently squirted two solid streams of oil sideways and all over the place hitting wall and stovetop, totally missing the targeted area/pan. Doesn't spray in the fan spray design like advertised and that shows on the adjustable sprayer tip. Looks good but is useless, very disappointed. Seller immediately refunded money after I contacted them regarding issue. Looking for a different sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: ENEYERAY

customer_reviews.title: Stream flow, yes, spray, no.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed at length all the different oil sprayers, and bought this one based on reviews. I made the wrong choice. The spray nozzle has three settings, off, spray, and stream. Right from the second use the spray function produces a stream, and not a spray. I understand that after some time that you would need to clean the nozzle, but not on second use! Both of the two units I bought perform in the same manner, one used for olive oil, and one used for canola oil.
customer_reviews.author: New Mexico Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Watch manuf Video to use properly
customer_reviews.text: I like this sprayer. I've used others in the past and the others were all garbage. This works great for what i'm using it for; coating skillets instead of aerosol spray. 95% of the complaints on here could be eliminated if they just watched the manufactures video (on the amazon product pictures). You must pump the sprayer quick along with a nice sweep to get good results. I would not recommend this for baking as I need more of a fine mist than a coating.
customer_reviews.author: Caker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a product that would give me a fine mist of oil, similar to an aerosol can. But one of the sprayers didn't work at all, and the one that work (more or less) gave me oil in big globs, no matter which nozzle setting I used. I might as well just pour in oil from the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Arcadia Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Updated: 5 stars down to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Needs a totally different nozzle! This one cloggs. Even though it was a bit expensive, I always wanted something that is more like a regular spray bottle. The feel and functionality were perfect, till may be , a month of use. It now sprays in two opposite directions, literally, with two streams only. I tried cleaning the nozzle with warm soapy water, but it did not improve the situation. I think this product should be recalled, or sold with a bunch of extra nozzles, but that is not ,really, a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Pth

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer tube too short!!  Defective.
customer_reviews.text: Very wasteful for oil. I have to fill it up completely because the tube attached to the sprayer is 2 inches too short! Have to hold container completely upright to get any oil to spray out. I didn't know this was not supposed to be like this until I compared it with my friend's who has two of them. Her tubes are much longer and she can spray out oil with container sideways. I found this out after the Amazon return date expired and I don't know how to get in touch with the manufacturer. PLEASE GET IN TOUCH WITH ME MANUFACTURER/DISTRIBUTOR!
customer_reviews.author: Melaney

customer_reviews.title: useless as a sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Received this sprayer, washed it , dried it well as instructed and put oil in it. Then I attempted to spray oil from it. I might just as well poured oil from the bottle. The "spray" pattern was wide as expected, but the oil came out in streams and globs rather then a spray. The amount of 1 spray was 20 fold what I needed and was used to. Unfortunately, this sprayer is in no way a replacement for "spray oil". I will be looking for another brand or going back to buying spray oil.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: Well made with thick solid glass
customer_reviews.text: You can feel the quality when you set this up. The sprayer feels solid and the glass jar is solid. The pump also feels solid. When it is filled with olive oil, sealed, and pumping you feel the quality. I paid more for the glass jar but i feel it is worth the extra cost. The sprayer has several spray modes to choose from. I like the mister but it does mix in some thicker droplets but that is minor. The yellow colored glass cuts down on sunlight affecting the contents. Overall, once I accepted the extra cost of glass vs plastic, I made the right choice. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Thick Uneven Spray
customer_reviews.text: What I was hoping for was an even mist like what you get from the aerosol cans. What this provides is thick and uneven, in no way superior to just drizzling oil from the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Tamsin

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: This is definately not what I expected from Evo. When you spray oil trigger instead of a mist I get a straight stream. Very disappointed in this product. I use in cooking demos so now I have to go buy a cheap plastic spray bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Jones

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't clogged yet!
customer_reviews.text: Most oil sprayers clog immediately, rendering them useless. This one hasn't done that yet. The only problem is that the feed tube into the oil chamber is directed to the wrong side, so you have to spray horizontally; you can't spray downward. This makes it difficult for most food & pan uses. The only way around it is to keep the chamber full of oil.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Broken on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate this product because it was broken on arrival. Trigger mechanism broken. The packaging was fine, but QC department at EVO didn't do their job. Sent back, may or may not give them another chance.
customer_reviews.author: Go Browns

customer_reviews.title: More reliable than the misto, but messier
customer_reviews.text: My Misto oil sprayer kept breaking, leaking, and eventually lost power. The trigger spray design of this is more reliable, and you can either get a thin concentrated stream or a fast, wide spray, which is nice. However, the fast wide spray can be pretty messy, since it comes out under pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement but overall ok
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it's ok. The spray isn't very fine or misty but better sustainability than the disposable bottles I kept buying at Walmart that you can't refill. It's also nice that you don't need to add a propellant like a lot of the commercial sprayer bottles which can damage your air fryer or other equipment. It holds a good amount of oil, it essentially has 2x different nozzle types, and is refillable so better for the environment. I think it's worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yamazaki

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed in these....the olive oil I use in these does not spray out in a mist.....which is what I wanted them for. Rather the oil comes out in globs and way too much of it. These are going into yard sale stuff! I do not recommend these at all if the consumer is looking for a mist sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESN’T WORK!
customer_reviews.text: For starters, this container is HUGE! If dimensions were given, I failed to see it and that would be my fault, but it is enormous! Secondly, the first spray was a nice even spray, every attempt was a targeted harsh stream! I immediately went to return this worthless $20 item, however they DO NOT accept returns! DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Air Fried Foods
customer_reviews.text: I have only just received this spray and used it once on a pork tenderloin that I cooked in my Air Fryer . The only problem I had, was trying to get the funnel that came with my order on the bottle - just could not get it screwed on. So - I just used my old funnel and that worked fine. The spray, once I got it filled, was very easy to use. No drips all over the fryer; I would highly recommend this product for use with an Air Fryer.
customer_reviews.author: KnittinKat

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTING: No Fan Spray
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I bought these was to replace buying aerosol cans of oil. While these spray out oil they do not have the nice, fan spray advertised. I'm using them for cooking and it's slightly better than dumping oil in a pan but they are not a replacement for my aerosol can. I still use that too. And it's not dishwasher safe. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: spray mechanism did not work right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The made in China spray head was non-functional right out of the box. Nothing came out of the spray head in any position with either water or oil. Since spray bottle mechanisms have been basically fool proof for decades in cheap products such as various cleaners and yard chemicals, one would expect that the mechanism in a $24 oil spray bottle should work flawlessly and should be durable, but such is not the case with the Evo bottle. Despite the hassle and Covid risk I am returning it for a refund. Unfortunately we have another example of terrible quality control in an overseas supplier who supplied the pump mechanism. DO NO WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Do not set near the stove.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 11/11/18 I was very disappointed when I picked up my bottle and there was huge hole in it. I always keep my cooking supplies near the stove and I guess it got too close. Something you don't realize until it happens! I don't think I would buy this one again. I was hoping it would be more durable. Original: Great bottle that can hold a lot of oil. The spray trigger is easy to use and the stream of oil comes out strong. It's more of a jet than a mist though. Overall a great tool to have in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large and takes some finesse to use without over oiling
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use for an air fryer and my nonstick cooking pans. Large bottle, can easily pour an entire bottle of olive oil in. Had to position the plastic hose strategically to get it to spray at a normal angle. Takes some getting used to - can easily over oil. The shape of the bottle is awkward to store - would recommend buying one of the smaller canister shaped ones from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great Oil Sprayer — Last a Long Time
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of Evo Oil Sprayers. I have had a larger one that I use for peanut oil for several years and it still works great. These are a little smaller, which I didn’t realize (my fault). Make sure you order the size you want. I’m using one of these with a mixture of Olive Oil and herbs. Works GREAT — you can just spray your toast with it. Very handy. I tried a different brand of oil sprayer because they were much higher capacity. They did not last very long at all. These Evo sprayers are designed much better and are very robust. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: EngineersGuideToGod

customer_reviews.title: very nice well made product
customer_reviews.text: wow does this thing work great. Ever since we got an air fryer we tear through the olive oil and this thing makes it so easy it sprays and nice wide fan or it has the option for the smaller fan of oil plus since its metal you don't have to worry about keeping it out of sunlight like you do with the plastic ones in my opinion its worth the few extra bucks to get the metal one. Ours stay in the window seal and we have never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: david amos

customer_reviews.title: spray nozzle sucks
customer_reviews.text: I picked this brand/bottle of oil spray for my air fryer because of its rave reviews but like some users had said, the nozzle spray squirts everywhere. It makes a huge mess all over my kitchen when I spray so I hate using it to spray even my baking/cooking pans on a daily basis. I'd always have to wrap my hands around the area to make sure it's not spraying all over my walls and floors as the sprays come out weirdly. Tried returning this item but this item is non-refundable. Avoid if possible. It was way too expensive for the quality you get. Maybe if I paid $5 for it, then I should have expected a crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great & Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: I have an air fryer. So I use this product to spray foods with olive oil. I find that it gets the job done well without spray all over the place like the aerosol spray cans. So it is a really good product if you are an air fryer cooker. I would recommend it particularly for the use of spraying foods. However, i would have preferred the glass bottle, but didn't realize the product came in glass and stainless steel until after I had purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Bruster

customer_reviews.title: eureka! no more pumping air into the bottle!!
customer_reviews.text: this item is dandy! it works very well to disburse minimal amounts of cooking oils to your cookware and/or food. and, it does so easily. no more fumbling trying to manually pump air into a spray can with a "special" lid. granted, the spray from this item is somewhat more coarse than that which is delivered by a commercial aerosol oil spray can but it is a thousand times less awkward than the the diy spray cans that require pumping before spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard N. Sanders Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Cook in Family
customer_reviews.text: I bought these oil spray bottles for my Dad for Father's day and he loves them. He does a lot of cooking and uses quite a bit of olive oil and peanut oil. He loves being able to just grab a bottle and give a quick squirt right where he needs it instead of pouring from the larger oil bottles he buys at the store. Not sure how easy they are to clean as he's never mentioned it but so far no clogging and they are easy to use. He's got sort of arthritic hands so the squeeze-pull trigger is great for him instead of the push-down-top models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed 😞
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bottle, after watching a video of someone using it. It is NOTHING like that video! I feel that it was a waste of my hard earned money!!! I went back to using a brush. The oil just squirts out (at least with the one I got) I thought it was a little high priced, but I wanted a good product - it really isn’t!
customer_reviews.author: Ysabel A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: YOU CANNOT RETURN THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to return this product!! I have not used it or tried it but I did not like how it looked and was unable to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Little Goes A Long Way
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I came across this product. I've always hated cooking with oil and no matter how little I'd use, I always thought I could use less. Love my purchase, it spritzes evenly and I like that I can adjust the nozzle for wide or narrow spraying. A teaspoon poured into a cooking pan isn't the same as a teaspoon sprayed. A little goes a long way. I keep my bottle with oil in the fridge and take it out a few minutes before using. Love also that it came with 3 labels for balsamic vinegar and different types of oil, as well as a little funnel to use when pouring the content into the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good but could be more reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: It sprays oil. It's pretty good for what it does and the purpose for which I bought it so I've no complaints. I think it's a bit overpriced for a spray bottle, it's not like it atomizes the oil or disburses it in a fine, full pattern. You squeeze the trigger, oil sprays out in a fan pattern, not perfectly consistent but it covers the intended area.
customer_reviews.author: BugKnuckle

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Using an air fryer, we wanted a way to spray olive oil on food; aerosol products available in the grocery store are to be used on the appliances themselves, not on food. This pump action bottle works well. We have had it for about two weeks. Also bought one for our son as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Christina  Buntin

customer_reviews.title: Not For Accurate Or Controlled Dispensing
customer_reviews.text: Product lacks ability to control rate or amount of oil. Trigger mechanism releases too much oil for my use and in a larger area than necessary. Reducing the amount of oil applied requires applying oil to a larger surface area (includes your range top if you want less oil on your food). There is no way to limit the oil released in a single spray without creating a streamy mess, usually onto surfaces that were unintended. Have a very large pan, great! Smaller utensils can be used with significant over-spray outside the pan area. Just creates an oily mess in the kitchen. Would return it if I could. Does not meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but mist could be finer.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after going through a few of the air pressure sprayers. I like them much better than the pressurized ones, but wish the mist was a bit finer. It comes out kinda like a squirt gun. That may work as well, but then I'd be tempted to blast my hubby with them every time he invades my kitchen. I am going to infuse one with garlic the next time I fill and see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: #1 DogMom

customer_reviews.title: Not a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected- oil would probably go rancid before I could use it. I don’t like the look of it in person- partially because it is so big and bright- wouldn’t like to display in my kitchen. Unfortunately for some reason I can’t return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Best value in kitchen oil sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many oil misters and sprayers. I settled on this product 3 years ago and now continue to purchase them to outfit my kids kitchens when Grandpa is at their house, he's the chef. I think I've bought about a dozen. You can pay a lot more for a device which does not work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hale

customer_reviews.title: Terrible...do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered yesterday and was ready to return in a half hour! Terrible product. Sprays in the fan direction when it feels like it. I practiced as soon as I opened the package. Randomly sprayed in fan shape, solid center stream, and crazy side stream...all without moving the nozzle selector. Thought the trouble might be in the nozzle selector, so I rotated around to the different settings, it did not make a difference. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Donna S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product - keep working on it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a workhorse. It does exactly what it says it will do without hesitation. It's downside is it quirts out a pretty hefty amount of oil and there is no way to turn it down. It has its place in the kitchen-- like on the grill. It does not replace the Misto oil sprayer which delivers a very small amount (but requires pumping up pressure frequently, having to maintain the nozzle, and cycling out the oil so it doesn't go rancid or gummy). I would definitely buy this again, though I do wish it was a finer spray. Adding a variable pressure valve to the trigger would do it (higher pressure leads to smaller droplets).
customer_reviews.author: niceman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We had a larger, plastic one for a few years and absolutely loved it! So when it got a little too close to the waffle maker I knew immediately I was ordering a new one. Then I found the glass one! It is just the right size to fit in the shelf too!
customer_reviews.author: Jealene Vest

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought one for each of my daughters.
customer_reviews.text: It works SO much better than the one that had to be pumped in order to spray. It takes a bit of practice to learn how far to hold it from the pan. It sprays in a fan, not a circle. Great for spraying on meats before frying or baking. I love olive oil on a toasted baguette and this is so much easier than drizzling. Good for salads too. It loses a star for the price (seems a lot for an empty spray bottle) but it didn't stop me from buying one for each of my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had discovered this YEARS ago!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking to replace the expensive aerosol spray cans of oil that I buy in the supermarket for years; the few others I tried that required pumping before spraying were singularly unacceptable. Not this baby! It fills easily, sprays evenly and accurately, and I don't waste oil, money, or the environment. I use this primarily when grilling, but it's also great when roasting vegetables or misting salads. If you even THINK you might find this useful, BUY IT! BTW, I think it might be weird as a gift (hence only 4 stars for giftability), but to each his own!
customer_reviews.author: Tom A.

customer_reviews.title: Spray is still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a way to track how much oil I was using in meals and it’s been amazing! I buy olive oil in bulk and it’s hard to measure out but this makes it so much easier. 7 pumps = 1 tbsp too so I actually get more use out of the oil because the spray distributes it better. When I started the bottle was full and now I’m at the bottom and it’s still spraying strong! Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I have had my sprayer for several months now. This is the 3 or 4 oil sprayer I've purchased and most have broken pretty quickly. This one seems fairly well made. I am happy with it. The spray is a little heavier than I'd like. I wish it had more of a "mist" option instead of a stream spray but it works perfectly. Just spray slower to prevent the splatter that mist would solve.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey Bizness

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day, and I ordered a second one to hold a different oil. So, I am a fan. My only complaint is that the shape of the bottle means it has to be pretty full to spray correctly. If the bottle were a little bit narrower, you could spray even when there's only an inch or so in the bottom. But because of the shape, you need to have 2-3 inches of oil in the bottle or it won't spray, because the normal spraying angle causes all the oil to fun into the corners. So, that's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, but I do really like it and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: love this product
customer_reviews.text: Being on a restricted diet, I can only use specific oil and not ones you buy in a spray can...so this item was recommended to me. I absolutely love it! it's so nice to hold, it sprays perfect, it uses significantly less oil than you would with pouring! I use it for everything from frying an egg, to roasting veggies!! The only draw back I would say is that sometimes it tends to drip a bit on the sprayer, but I just got used to wiping it with a napkin after each use...definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Nice olive oil sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking sprayer. I haven't had any problem with this sprayer. Easy to clean; just fill with warm soapy water attach sprayer and spray. After cleaning with the soapy water run clear water through both bottle and sprayer and refill. I would purchase this sprayer again. Much easier to use to spray meat,veg. and then season with spices. Does save on olive oil usage.
customer_reviews.author: thankful

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay... Not the best
customer_reviews.text: It works okay. It just dispenses way too much and in a too large of a spread. When you go gentle on the spray handle it just comes out as a stream and not spray. I'm sure there are better spray bottles out there. I would skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to not use spray bottles of what ever is in the can
customer_reviews.text: I love these, I had the one large EVO and really just to large for just my husband and myself. I felt like to much to keep so long on counter without washing it and putting fresh olive oil in. I use the other one for Canola Oil for my husband to use on the grill instead of buying the spray oils in the cans. I also like the slightly different color of the bottles as if you don't have the label to tell you what you have in it, the color would remind you of which is which.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki & Chaz Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Oil Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Best oil sprayer(s) I have ever used. Pull the trigger fast for best results, just make sure you are on target. I use it daily for oiling pans, spraying olive oil on vegetables before roasting, etc. They must be tough, because they came in a big box with 15 other items and the box was half full..... and no packing materials ! In fact, one of the sprayers was off of the card. Never seen a box from Amazon arrive that way......in 15-20 years. Great sprayers though, I'm thinking of also getting the stainless one.
customer_reviews.author: Jona Ozo

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre.  I'll look for something better.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, fits my hand, sprayer is easy to operate. That said; I don't think I would buy this again. The spray pattern is not efficient. Too much oil in one spot. I would prefer a finer mist and a rounder pattern. While spraying oil your fingers get oil all over them. I'll look for something else because I need to be able to spray oil some onto items rather than brushing it on.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I would give zero stars if allowed. Quit working shortly after return window closed. This NEVER sprayed in a mist. It came out in a big blob of oil no matter the setting it was on. Now, just 2 months after purchase, it has stopped working completely. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected a quality bottle and sprayer. This is a cheaply built item. Thin plastic bottle and lightweight plastic pumping mechanism. I bought it as a gift for my wife and was embarrassed to give it to her. It is functional so will use it until it fails then replace it with a better quality item. In rating this item, three "features" were shown to be rated: "Easy to use", "Sheerness", and "Easy to clean". No rating was requested for quality, or function (e.g. spray pattern and proper flow). I have no idea what "Sheerness" is for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Super handy! I have been through so many generic spray bottle through the years trying to find one that works with olive oil for my popcorn. This is great! It is NOT a mister; it is generous, but not excessive. I also have found that more committed you are, the better the spray comes out. If you are trying to be all careful and delicate, the oil will come out in bigger droplets. But if you confidently grip that trigger and let 'er rip, the spray is great. We use it a lot to spray sliced veggies for grilling, and for the aforementioned popcorn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Evo Oil Sprayer Bottle, Non-Aerosol for Olive Oil and Cooking Oils, Stainless Steel, 16-ounce Capacity
product_meta.description:
Style Name:16 oz., Stainless SteelEvo Stainless Steel Non-Aerosol Oil Sprayer Bottle, the world’s first non-aerosol trigger sprayer with a unique fan-shaped spray, easily dispenses cooking oil without harmful additives, propellants or chemicals. Beautifully crafted from stainless steel, the slim heat-safe design displays right on the counter or stores in the fridge. Generous 16-ounce capacity keeps the most used healthy cooking oil ready where needed. Great at the grill! Perfect for EVOO (extra virgin olive oil), canola oil, avocado oil, grapeseed oil, even infused oils with herbs and spices. Great for balsamic vinegar, lime juice, and cooking wine too. Makes preparing healthy meals and practicing portion control easier! Evo allows complete control over calories, nutrition and food purity. Every pull of the trigger delivers a precise 1.35-milliliters in a unique fan pattern that covers more cooking surface with less oil. The scalloped trigger offers a natural ergonomic feel and secure grip. Helpful anywhere food is being prepared, cooked and served, even grillside for an easy outdoor lifestyle. Coat vegetables for roasting or broiling, flavor fillets for baking or steak for grilling, finish foods before serving, and apply salad dressing. Easier to use than a traditional oil vaporizer or oil mister. No pumping, priming, or messy, clogged oil dispensers! Simply fill and firmly pull the trigger for consistent, even coverage. Made from 18/8 stainless steel with a brushed finish, Evo is FDA approved, BPA, Latex, lead, DEHP free, Proposition 65 compliant, food safe, heat safe, durable, and recyclable. Won’t shatter or melt. More economical than aerosol cooking spray. Stow easily in the fridge. Hand wash in warm, soapy water.
*Funnel and silicone identification bands are not included and must be purchased separately
